content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's the implementation of the `add_yearmonth` function in Julia:

```julia
function add_yearmonth!(df)
    df[:ym] = map(dt -> parse(Int, string(year(dt), lpad(month(dt), 2), "0"))), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` with the yearmonth values in the format "yyyymm".

Note that this implementation modifies the input DataFrame `df` in place. If you want to keep the original DataFrame unchanged, you can modify the function to return a new DataFrame instead of modifying the input.
